title: Do you think Apple will ever get rid of the iPhone notch? - Quora

response.answer_text: The iPhone X notch that Apple introduced in late 2017 is a compromise between gorgeous design and sophisticated functionality. Apple wanted to make an all-screen iPhone for years, but it waited for technology to catch up with its dreams. But the iPhone maker couldn’t create a phone with a screen that occupies the entire front of a phone in 2017. The notch had to exist to house all those smartphone features that can’t be relocated or killed, including the new Face ID facial recognition system that had no rivals over on Android. Apple kept in place the iPhone X design last year, and it’s expected to do the same thing in 2019. But the tech Apple needs to kill the notch is already here, and 2020 may bring us the iPhone of our dreams. In the meantime, try thinking of it as a positive instead of a negative: Apple could have blacked out the space on either side of the notch - instead they chose to give the user bonus screen space on either side of the notch.

Sure, in the future. But as of right now there is no way to put this,  Under a screen. And until that becomes possible (and reliable mind you), the notch will stay. But if aesthetics are more valuable to you than security is there are plenty of other companies out there with that mindset, just don’t expect Apple to ever be one.

Apple has become a mismanaged company that is making many mistakes but cannot admit that they are doing so. So no, they will never admit that the notch is horrible. Your best bet is to buy an Android phone with unlocked bootloader (e.g. Oneplus) and install LineageOS on it to stop the Google spying.
I own an iPhone X, and I don’t care.
